Advocate.origin: [Latin advocatus adviser to a party in a lawsuit, counselor, from past participle of advocare to summon, employ as counsel, from ad to + vocare to call]

1.definition: a person (as a lawyer) who works and argues in support of another's cause esp. in court

2.definition: a person or group that defends or maintains a cause or proposal [a consumer ][ad-və-kāt] vb

-cat·ing.definition: to argue in favor ofto act as an advocate [shall for minority business "V. M. Rivera"]
